country_overview.content: Egypt, a land of ancient wonders and rich cultural heritage, is one of the most fascinating destinations in the world. Home to the iconic pyramids, the majestic Nile River, and vibrant cities like Cairo and Alexandria, Egypt offers a unique blend of history, adventure, and relaxation. Egypt's visa policy accommodates various types of travelers, from tourists and business visitors to students and expatriates. With a range of visa options available, it is important for travelers to understand the specific requirements and processes involved in obtaining a visa to ensure a smooth entry into the country.

tourist_visa.title: Tourist Visa
tourist_visa.description: The Tourist Visa is issued to foreign nationals who wish to visit Egypt for tourism purposes, such as exploring historical sites, experiencing Egyptian culture, or enjoying a vacation. The visa is typically valid for a stay of up to 30 days, with the option to extend the stay if needed. Single and multiple entry options are available.

business_visa.title: Business Visa
business_visa.description: The Business Visa is designed for foreign nationals who need to travel to Egypt for business-related activities, including meetings, conferences, and negotiations. The visa can be granted for a single entry or multiple entries, depending on the nature of the business activities. The duration of the stay is typically up to 30 days, but extensions may be possible.

student_visa.title: Student Visa
student_visa.description: The Student Visa is issued to foreign students who have been accepted into a recognized educational institution in Egypt. This visa is typically valid for the duration of the course of study and allows students to stay in Egypt for the entire period of their education, with provisions for re-entry during vacations.

work_visa.title: Work Visa
work_visa.description: The Work Visa is granted to foreign nationals who have secured employment in Egypt. It is required for those intending to work legally in the country. The Work Visa is typically issued for a one-year period and can be renewed based on the terms of employment. Employers are required to sponsor the visa and provide necessary documentation.

residence_visa.title: Residence Visa
residence_visa.description: The Residence Visa is for foreign nationals who wish to live in Egypt for an extended period, either for retirement, long-term employment, or other purposes. This visa is issued for one year and can be renewed. Applicants must demonstrate financial stability and provide evidence of long-term accommodation in Egypt.

tourist_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must have a valid passport, be in good health, and demonstrate the intention to leave Egypt before the visa expires. Proof of sufficient financial means and a clear purpose for the visit are also required.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Hotel reservations or an invitation letter from friends/family in Egypt

business_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must be invited by an Egyptian business partner or organization and have a clear purpose for the visit. The applicant should also demonstrate the intention to return to their home country upon the completion of the business activities.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Invitation letter from the Egyptian company
Company registration certificate of the inviting company
additional_documents: Previous business correspondence with the inviting company
Proof of sufficient funds for the duration of stay

student_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must have received an acceptance letter from a recognized educational institution in Egypt and must be able to demonstrate the financial ability to support their studies and stay in the country.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Acceptance letter from the educational institution
Proof of financial support (e.g., bank statements)

step_1.title: Determine Visa Type
step_1.description: Identify the correct visa type based on your purpose of travel to Egypt. Ensure that you meet the eligibility criteria for the chosen visa category.

step_2.title: Check Eligibility
step_2.description: Review the specific eligibility requirements for the visa type you are applying for. This may include health checks, financial requirements, and documentation needs.

step_3.title: Gather Required Documents
step_3.description: Collect all necessary documents, including the visa application form, passport, photographs, and supporting documents relevant to your visa type.

step_4.title: Fill Out the Application Form
step_4.description: Complete the visa application form accurately. You can usually find the form on the official website of the Egyptian embassy or consulate in your country.

step_5.title: Submit the Application
step_5.description: Submit your completed application form along with the required documents at the nearest Egyptian embassy or consulate. In some countries, online submission might be available.

step_6.title: Wait for Processing
step_6.description: The processing time varies depending on the visa type and your country of residence. Be patient and ensure that you provide any additional information if requested by the visa authorities.

step_7.title: Receive the Visa
step_7.description: Once your visa is approved, you will be notified to collect it. Ensure that all the details on the visa are correct before your travel.

visa_fees.content: Visa fees vary based on the type of visa, the number of entries, and the nationality of the applicant. The fees are non-refundable and must be paid at the time of application. Fees can be paid in cash, by credit card, or via other accepted methods at the consulate or embassy.

processing_time.content: Processing times for Egyptian visas generally range from 5 to 15 business days, depending on the type of visa and your country of residence. It's advisable to apply well in advance of your planned travel date.

visa_validity.content: The validity of an Egyptian visa depends on the type and number of entries allowed. For example, tourist visas are usually valid for 30 days with a single entry, while business visas may offer multiple entries and longer validity.

entry_requirements.content: Upon arrival in Egypt, travelers must present their valid visa, passport, and sometimes proof of accommodation and sufficient funds. It's essential to adhere to the entry requirements to avoid complications at the border.

faq_1.question: Can I extend my visa while in Egypt?
faq_1.answer: Yes, certain visas can be extended while you are in Egypt. You need to apply for an extension at the local Passport and Immigration Office before your current visa expires.

faq_2.question: Is visa-free entry available for Egypt?
faq_2.answer: Egypt offers visa-free entry for citizens of certain countries, mostly from the Middle East and Africa. However, for most nationalities, a visa is required.

faq_3.question: Can I work in Egypt on a tourist visa?
faq_3.answer: No, working on a tourist visa is strictly prohibited. You must apply for a work visa if you intend to work in Egypt legally.
